title: Inverse Functions - domain and range concerns

content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals square root of 4 minus x squared end root"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>  for <math alttext="negative 2 less or equal than x less or equal than 0"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Which of the following expressions defines <math alttext="f to the power of negative 1 end exponent open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><msup><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label: ​<math alttext="negative square root of 4 minus x squared end root"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><msqrt><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>  for  <math alttext="negative 2 less or equal than x less or equal than 0"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="square root of 4 minus x squared end root"><semantics><msqrt><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>  for  <math alttext="negative 2 less or equal than x less or equal than 0"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="negative square root of 4 minus x squared end root"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><msqrt><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>  for  <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 2"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​​<math alttext="square root of 4 minus x squared end root"><semantics><msqrt><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>  for  <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 2"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​​<math alttext="negative square root of 4 minus x squared end root"><semantics><mrow><mo>-</mo><msqrt><mn>4</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></msqrt></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>  for  <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 2"><semantics><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
